intro: Bupleurum odontites var. baldense, commonly known as the Balkan bugleweed, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are pinnate and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
